summary: This bill, the Chesapeake Bay Conservation Acceleration Act of 2025, focuses on conservation efforts in the Chesapeake Bay watershed. It establishes a new initiative to assist farmers in implementing conservation activities, provides funding through existing programs, and creates a task force to improve nutrient reduction reporting. The bill also amends existing legislation to support the Conservation Reserve Enhancement Program (CREP) and establishes a pilot program for the establishment of eligible conservation practices. Additionally, it addresses workforce development in food and agricultural sciences and modifies regulatory oversight regarding invasive catfish.
